snippet: The withering assault on the neighborhood of Shejaiya, and the death of 87 Palestinians and 13 Israeli soldiers and officers, appeared to shake the international community.
abstract: Israel's withering assault on Gaza City neighborhood of Shejaiya is centerpiece of deadliest day so far in conflict, claiming lives of 87 Palestinians and 13 Israeli soldiers; death toll among Palestinians has risen to at least 425, including more than 100 children; violence shakes international community as criticism of Israel mounts; Sec of State John Kerry will head to Cairo in attempt to negotiate cease-fire.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and ISABEL KERSHNER
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Gaza, and Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem. Reporting was contributed by Fares Akram and Tyler Hicks from Gaza, Jodi Rudoren from Tel Aviv, Michael R. Gordon from Washington, and Somini Sengupta from New York.

lead_paragraph: The withering assault on the neighborhood of Shejaiya, and the death of 87 Palestinians and 13 Israeli soldiers and officers, appeared to shake the international community.

headline.sub: World Leaders Call for Restraint; Kerry Headed to Cairo
headline.main: Neighborhood Ravaged on Deadliest Day So Far for Both Sides in Gaza
headline.print_headline: Neighborhood Ravaged on Deadliest Day So Far for Both Sides in Gaza
